channel.title: (static ip) Usefull people who want to port forward. Game Applications
channel.description: first go to run cmd or command type ipconfig you should see your ip and that. then type ipconfig/release you should loose your internet connection for like 2 min but you will get it back. go to start network connections click on your local area connection or your name of your connection. right click it then click properties then you should get a window that pops up click tcp/ip thingy. Then you should have nothing in there if you do have something in there click obtain ip adress. then click the 2nd one then type in anything for example 123.123.123.123 then press ok then press ok agian now if you go to start run cmd then typeee ipconfig you can see your ip adress you just entered. then go back to your start network connections right click properties then go back to tcp/ip then click the obtain ip adress make sure nothing is there just click the first one . Now reboot your computer then you are connectional then go to start run cmd ipconfig you can see your new STATIC IP and you now have internet ENJOY!!!!!!!!!!!! :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D ;D ;D ;D :| :| :| :|

item.title: (static ip) Usefull people who want to port forward. Game Applications
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

lol, you’re extremly funny.

YOUR LOCAL IP CAN STAY STATIC BUT NOT YOUR ‘REAL’ IP ADDRESS SINCE YOU CAN’T ASSIGN IT DUE TO THE FACT IF SOMEONE ELSE HAS IT, IT WILL FUCK UP YOUR COMPUTER

Read full topic

item.title: (static ip) Usefull people who want to port forward. Game Applications
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

Not static, dyanmic.

static means it will never change and you cant choose your ip address you can choose your local ip not your ‘real’ ip

Read full topic

item.title: (static ip) Usefull people who want to port forward. Game Applications
item.dc:creator: @dabaddest dabaddest
item.description:
@dabaddest wrote:

first go to run cmd or command type ipconfig you should see your ip and that.
then type ipconfig/release you should loose your internet connection for like 2 min but you will get it back.
go to start network connections click on your local area connection or your name of your connection.
right click it then click properties then you should get a window that pops up click tcp/ip thingy.
Then you should have nothing in there if you do have something in there click obtain ip adress.
then click the 2nd one then type in anything for example 123.123.123.123 then press ok then press ok agian
now if you go to start run cmd then typeee ipconfig you can see your ip adress you just entered.
then go back to your start network connections right click properties then go back to tcp/ip
then click the obtain ip adress make sure nothing is there just click the first one .
Now reboot your computer then you are connectional then go to start run cmd ipconfig
you can see your new STATIC IP and you now have internet ENJOY!!! ;D ;D ;D

Read full topic
